topic: Starmer's confrontation with Reform UK at Labour conference, accusing them of racist policies.
evaluation: This cluster effectively tracks Keir Starmer's focused confrontation with Reform UK during the Labour Party conference. It begins with his explicit accusation of 'racist' policies on Sep 28 (Articles 1, 7, 8), progresses to his main conference speech on Sep 30 where he 'draws up battle lines' (Article 3), and concludes with an evaluation of that speech's impact on Oct 01 (Article 4). The narrative is continuous, developmental, and strictly relevant to this specific political event and Starmer's strategy. Noise articles (2, 5, 6, 9, 10) were de-noised as they either covered broader, non-conference-specific political analysis, unrelated policy announcements, or leadership challenges separate from the Reform UK confrontation.
